intro: Leucas chiatelliniana, commonly known as the velvet leaf hyssop, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. Its flowers are typically purple or blue, arranged in whorled clusters at the ends of the stems. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has mild medicinal properties in traditional herbal use.
